TopicTitle: I Wonder when KSP Gonna Have Graphics Like That

Articles.Content:
It's so pretty..

Hopefully people will stop with the conspiracy theories about the black squares now haha.

Someone's already blabbing in some Russian science forum that the black square is the machine gun... censored by DoD

UPD. Or are they using Sunbeam addon?
Hah, the black square is obviously a radiator.
Haha, or it's just a blind spot where they can't angle the camera.

Now to the subject pleeeease.

Just when?

(an answer "when Charr freezes over" apparently won't satisfy me )

Of course I can't speak for Squad and this is just my personal opinion but I don't think KSP will ever have graphics like that. I think they are going for a much more surrealist and cartoon-like aesthetic for the game, which I prefer. I would imagine they'll adjust the lighting engine for different planets in the future though (maybe when they do weather).

Basically, I see the following here:

  • Bump-mapped terrain textures (doable).
  • Much dense terrain subdivisions (not likely; even the one currently handled by PQS is a little over the edge...).
  • Some replacement for atmospheric shader to work in conjunction with terrain one to emulate fog (given that current, quite simple implementation, already lags like crazy -- unlikely again . And I doubt Unity fog system is of much use here).
  • Modifying terrain textures at real time to add vessel/astronaut tracks and engine burn marks (technically it's possible... but a helluva lot of job).
  • Realtime terrain shadows with almost infinite drawing distance (derp, I just dunno ... Unity has no direct support for doing this, but maybe someday, with some kind of smart@$$ shader...)
  • ???

So, well, "realistic physical interactions, outstanding graphics, highest FPS possible, and no saves at all... the game name's Life"

Edited August 14, 2012 by Tosh
